Utterance: <synch>
Hi there! It’s nice to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been doing okay, still working on the communication with my daughters and my mom.
That’s great to hear you’re continuing to work on those relationships. Have you had any conversations with your daughters since we practiced?
Yes, I talked to them, and it went better than I expected.
That’s fantastic! What did you notice during that conversation?
They seemed receptive and actually opened up about their feelings.
That’s a huge breakthrough! It sounds like you created a safe space for them. How did that make you feel?
I felt relieved and proud that we could talk openly.
That’s wonderful! It’s a significant step in strengthening your relationship. Have you had a chance to implement any strategies with your mom?
I tried setting lighter topics, but it was challenging.
It’s understandable. Sometimes old patterns can be difficult to break. What specifically made it challenging?
She kept bringing up past issues, and I felt overwhelmed.
That’s tough. It’s important to stick to your boundaries. Would you like to brainstorm some phrases to redirect the conversation?
Yes, I’d like that.
You could say something like, “I’d prefer to focus on the present right now.” How does that sound?
That sounds helpful. I can see how that could work.
Great! It’s all about finding what feels comfortable for you. Have you noticed any changes in your feelings of guilt regarding your mom?
I think it’s lessening. I’m starting to accept that I did what I needed to do for my mental health.
That’s an important realization! Acceptance can be a powerful part of healing. Have you found any moments of joy or connection with your family lately?
Yes, we had a fun movie night recently, and it felt nice to bond.
That’s wonderful! Those moments can really strengthen relationships. How did that feel for you?
It felt great to laugh together. It reminded me of the good times.
That’s beautiful! It’s essential to create those joyful moments. Have you thought about how you can incorporate more of those into your routine?
I’d like to plan more family activities, maybe a game night or outings.
That sounds like a fantastic idea! Planning those activities can help build stronger connections. Is there anything you’d like to address regarding your feelings about your size or weight?
I’ve been trying to focus less on that. I want to feel good in my own skin.
That’s a healthy mindset. Would you like to explore ways to foster body positivity?
Yes, that would be helpful.
One approach could be practicing positive affirmations. For example, “I appreciate my body for what it does for me.” How does that resonate with you?
I like that idea. It feels empowering.
Empowerment is key! How about we create a few affirmations together that you can use daily?
Yes, let’s do that!
How about, “I am worthy of love and respect just as I am”?
I love that one!
Great! Let’s come up with a couple more together.
“I celebrate my uniqueness” sounds good.
That’s a beautiful affirmation! One more?
“I am strong and capable” feels right.
Perfect! Those affirmations can help reinforce a positive self-image. How do you feel about incorporating these into your daily routine?
I think it will help me shift my mindset.
Absolutely! Consistency is key. Before we wrap up, is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think we covered a lot. I feel more equipped to handle my relationships and my own feelings.
I’m glad to hear that! Remember, progress takes time, and you’re doing great. For our next session, we can continue to explore these themes and any new challenges that arise.
Thank you so much for your support!
You’re very welcome! I look forward to our next session. Goodbye!
Bye!
